content: summer donuts materials needed bernat super value or red heart super saver in a donut colour i used rhss in cafe latte icing pink donut bernat super value in peony pink chocolate donut red heart super saver in coffee blueberry donut bernat super value in cool blue mc and royal blue cc lemon donut red heart super saver in pale yellow mc and lemon cc watermelon donut bernat super value in berry mc black cc1 lush cc2 and kelly cc3 orange donut red heart super saver in pumpkin mc red heart super saver in pale yellow cc1 and bernat super value in carrot cc2 quantity of yarn used i used approx 7 4g of yarn for the donut bottom and 8 6g of yarn for the icing this number may vary pending on your gauge i ve included this bit of information as reference only stitch marker polyester stuffing gauge is not important for this project but you do need a tight fabric to maintain the shape and keep the stuffing in bernat super value and red heart super saver recommend a 5mm or 5 5mm hook on their label for regular gauge i use a 4mm hook to make it tight enough for toys finished size of mine is approx 4 3 pattern for donut bottom use donut coloured yarn chain 18 join with a slip_stitch to form a ring row 1 chain 1 single_crochet through back loops around do not join 18sts row 2 *2sc in the next single_crochet single_crochet in the next 2 single_crochet repeat from * around 24sc row 3 *2sc in the next single_crochet single_crochet in the next 3 single_crochet repeat from * around 30sc row 4 *2sc in the next single_crochet single_crochet in the next 4 single_crochet repeat from * around 36sc row 5 *2sc in the next single_crochet single_crochet in the next 5 single_crochet repeat from * around 42sc row 6-8 single_crochet in each single_crochet around 42sc slip_stitch in next st then fasten_off for icing please note that the colourwork instructions are written on the next page the row are worked the same way for both solid icing and multicoloured icing with the exception of the orange donut please see notes on the next page you ll be working row 1-7 of the donut bottom for the icing the same way and row 8 will be the textured joining row the trick is to join the two halves the right way working from row 1 on donut bottom with ws of the donut facing you put your crochet hook through the top v of the single_crochet in row one working from the donut hole to the inside ws of the donut start with row 1 as you work row 1-7 the ws will be facing each other like the inside of a sandwich and the rs of the icing will be on top of the donut while the rs of the bottom of the donut will face down as you work row 8
